article:
{{Superherobox|  image= |caption=S.T.R.I.P.E.
with Stargirl Art by Alex Ross |comic_color=background:#8080ff  |character_name=S.T.R.I.P.E.
|real_name=Patrick "Pat" Dugan |publisher=DC Comics |debut=Action Comics #40
(September 1941). |creators=Jerry Siegel Hal Sherman
|alliance_color=background:#ffc0c0  |alliances=Justice Society of America Stars and
S.T.R.I.P.E. Infinity Inc. Seven Soldiers of Victory All-Star
Squadron |aliases=Stripesy |powers=Powered armor, genius level intellect
|}}

'S.T.R.I.P.E.' ('Special Tactics Robotic Integrated Power Enhancer') is a
superhero in the DC Comics universe. S.T.R.I.P.E. is a powered armor suit
invented and worn by 'Patrick "Pat" Dugan', the former adult sidekick to teenage
superhero Sylvester Pemberton, the Star-Spangled Kid. "Stripesy", as he is often
called, is a gifted mechanic who built the Star Rocket Racer, a bubble-topped
limousine with the functions of a rocket and helicopter. Together, they were
members of the Seven Soldiers of Victory and the All-Star Squadron. Stripesy was
created by Jerry Siegel (co-creator of Superman) and Hal Sherman, and first
appeared in [[Action Comics]] #40 (September 1941).
categories: Fictional American people of Irish descent
